VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {central cluster} pattern.

EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.94}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Technology Adoption on the y-axis?

SC.A: The average heat value for Access on the y-axis is {0.32}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Public Health and Outcomes or the cell corresponding to Clinics and Regulations?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Clinics} and {Regulations} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Research and Regulations or the cell corresponding to Telemedicine and Staffing?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Research} and {Regulations} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Medical Devices and Patient Satisfaction or the cell corresponding to Patient Care and Patient Satisfaction?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Medical Devices} and {Patient Satisfaction} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.21 to 0.41?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Medical Devices, Access), (Patient Care, Access), (Public Health, Access), (Research, Access), (Public Health, Epidemiology), (Research, Epidemiology), (Telemedicine, Epidemiology), (Wellness, Epidemiology), (Telemedicine, Funding), (Wellness, Funding), (Wellness, Outcomes)}.
